sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's been three months since the start of the Russian invasion of Ukraine and the city of Irpin is in ruins.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: According to local authorities, fighting and shelling has destroyed two-thirds of the buildings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The damage is estimated to be over 1.2 billion euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky thanked the US for their financial support to his country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I am grateful to President Joe Biden for immediately signing the 37 billion euro support package for Ukraine approved by Congress.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This is a historic contribution to the protection of freedom in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In the Kherson region, Russian troops guard the Kharkovka hydroelectric station, a power plant next to the Dnieper River.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Pro-Russian Ukrainian officials claim their presence has protected the plant from looting and possible sabotage, and that Crimea has been reconnected to a water supply.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The situation in Donbass is extremely difficult.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As in previous days, the Russian army is trying to attack Slovyansk and Severodonetsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The armed forces of Ukraine are restraining this offensive every day, and our defenders are repelling these offensive plans of Russia disrupting them and this is a concrete contribution to the approach of the main day the coveted day we all look forward to and fight for Victory Day meanwhile some residents of Harkiv say they're eager to come home, the uncertainty of the fighting and the risks of renewed shelling gives families with young children pause.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Well, for us older people, we want to return to our houses for the simple reason we can leave if they hit us again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But there are many families with young children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: One, two or five people in the same apartment and they have no place to stay if they shell again. They can hardly return.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In May, Ukrainian forces pushed back Russian troops to the north and east despite constant shelling. In the face of the destruction, residents faced the daunting task of rebuilding their lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Spain is feeling the heat after temperatures soar, reaching up to 15 degrees above average for the season.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: With some areas reaching a scorching 44 degrees Celsius on Saturday, this unprecedented heat wave could make May the hottest month of the century.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It is estimated that about 2,000 people a year die in Spain due to excessive heat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Scientists warn that heat waves could become much more common and intense globally in the years to come due to the impact of the climate crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Spanish Meteorology Agency says the climates of North Africa are moving towards the south of Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This means that by the middle of the century, longer and more intense periods of drought and of course higher temperatures will be more frequent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: For example, the summers in a relatively cool Spanish city such as La Coru√±a could be similar to the climate of the Moroccan city of Casablanca.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Spanish government has issued extreme heat warnings in several areas of the country, advising all to stay hydrated, limit physical activity and to stay in cool areas whenever possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: President Joe Biden has arrived in Japan at Yokota Air Base on Sunday for the second leg of his trip to reinforce U.S. alliances in Asia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He is expected to meet the Japanese prime minister and unveil a U.S.-led trade initiative for the region on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This visit comes after spending three days in South Korea discussing trade and security interests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We are prepared for anything North Korea does.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We've thought through how we respond to whatever they do, and so I'm not concerned if that's what you're suggesting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: During his South Korean stay, the U.S. president appeared with the Hyundai chief executive, During his South Korean stay, the U.S. president appeared with the Hyundai chief executive, highlighting the company's pledge for an over 9 billion euro tech and electric car investment in the U.S.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Before leaving for Japan, President Biden also visited Osan Air Base in Pyeongtaek, where thousands of U.S. and South Korean service members worked side by side.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: When New Delhi banned wheat exports as prices soared over Russia's invasion of Ukraine, it provoked concern abroad, driving cereal prices even higher.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Now Indian farmers are fuming.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Wheat traders such as Raj Sood say they have been denied a windfall as domestic prices plummet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Government believed requirements would be met with full yield and they will export, he says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But there was a 20% shortfall in the yield because of the heatwave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: When the government realised the production loss, they called for a ban.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Before the war in Ukraine and the heatwave, India's wheat production of 109 million tonnes last year and 7 million tonnes of exports had been expected to rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This year we had half the yield because of the heatwave, wheat farmer Rajwant Singh says,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: as the upper portion of the wheat pods dried and fell.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: India is the world's second biggest wheat producer, but the government says it's choosing to protect food security for its population, despite inflation concerns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In a city that had become used to the sound of wailing air raid sirens over the last three months, the gentle hum of an orchestra warming up, an overly welcomed change, as the National Opera House of Ukraine reopened its doors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The theatre, which could normally seat 1,000 people, was limited to about 300, in case people had to be evacuated to an underground shelter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I'm a doctor and have been busy treating wounded soldiers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I hope that peace prevails so that everyone can come to performances like this with no fear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The audience in Kyiv treated to the frothy melodies of the Barber of Seville instead of the thuds of artillery from nearby suburbs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's Minister of Culture says it's important for residents to try and enjoy life even in a time of war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The world's top leaders from politics, civil society, media and the arts are making their way to the Swiss mountain village of Davos for the first in-person World Economic Forum in more than two years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: 2,500 delegates will strive to find solutions to the world's most urgent challenges, such as the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The forum founder says it's happening at the most consequential geopolitical and geoeconomic time since its creation, against the backdrop of a once-in-a-century pandemic. UN climate summit, COP26, the One Trillion Trees project and many more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While the war will overshadow the meeting, the forum will also have panels on everything from climate change to gender inequality, football and the metaverse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Although this year's meeting will be lacking some of the star power of the past, including Chinese President Xi Jinping, who spoke at a virtual forum in January.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: When it comes to wine, varieties from France and Italy are well known on the European market.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But what about Moldova?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Thanks to its mild winters and long summers, this small Balkan nation is one of the world's top 20 wine producers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In the early 2000s, Russia and Ukraine were the country's best customers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: However, Moldovan winemakers are now turning their attention westwards.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Russian market was our traditional market, but that comes with its disadvantages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The prices are not the same, they are lower than in the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In the EU, you can charge higher prices for wine, but there the focus is on quality, which is not the case with Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Recently we had a gathering of fellow winemakers and I've noticed that all the boys are shifting to export to the Middle East, the European market and the Scandinavian one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: While international sanctions and the ongoing conflict in Ukraine are driving up production costs for Moldovan winemakers, the former Soviet republic sold 120 litres to Europe last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A glass of Moldovan fetishka Regale might soon become a popular alternative for consumers of Italy's Pinot Grigio.

sentences.sentence: While French fans are rejoicing, those in Spain are fuming after football star Kylian Mbapp√© signed on for another three years with Paris Saint-Germain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Mbappe has been playing both sides, first saying that he wanted to come to Madrid, then staying at PSG for the money. I'm not interested in Mbappe anymore. I'm sorry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: He's a great player. I liked him before, but not anymore. I don't want him at Real Madrid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: player. I liked him before, but not anymore. I don't want him at Real Madrid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

Following a multi-million euro deal to give the 23-year-old in Paris, projected to be the biggest contract in football history, the Spanish La Liga has issued a statement indicating their intent to sue the French club over an alleged breach of financial rules.
